name: Barbarian
description: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage.

traits.name: Starting Proficiencies
traits.description: As a Barbarian, you have proficiencies that reflect your martial and primal nature.

features.name: Rage
features.description: On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven’t attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then.

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

features.name: Reckless Attack
features.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation, giving you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

effects.condition: on your melee weapon attacks using Strength this turn
attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn

features.name: Danger Sense
features.description: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can’t be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

features.name: Primal Path
features.description: You choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Fast Movement
features.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren’t wearing heavy armor.

features.name: Feral Instinct
features.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and aren’t incapacitated, you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Brutal Critical
features.description: You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack. This increases to two additional dice at 13th level and three additional dice at 17th level.

features.name: Relentless Rage
features.description: If you drop to 0 hit points while you’re raging and don’t die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw to drop to 1 hit point instead. The DC increases by 5 for each use after the first.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Persistent Rage
features.description: Your rage is so fierce that it ends early only if you fall unconscious or if you choose to end it.

effects.modification: ends only on unconsciousness or choice

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Indomitable Might
features.description: If your total for a Strength check is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1.

features.name: Primal Champion
features.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclasses.name: Path of the Berserker
subclasses.description: For some barbarians, rage is a means to an end—that end being violence. The Path of the Berserker is a path of untrammeled fury, slick with blood.

features.name: Frenzy
features.description: While raging, you can go into a frenzy to make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

features.name: Mindless Rage
features.description: You can’t be charmed or frightened while raging.

features.name: Intimidating Presence
features.description: You can use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence.

features.name: Retaliation
features.description: When you take damage from a creature that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

subclasses.name: Path of the Totem Warrior
subclasses.description: The Path of the Totem Warrior is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as a guide, protector, and inspiration.

features.name: Spirit Seeker
features.description: You gain the ability to cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells, but only as rituals.

features.name: Totem Spirit
features.description: You choose a totem spirit and gain its feature while raging.

features.name: Aspect of the Beast
features.description: You gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice.

features.name: Spirit Walker
features.description: You can cast the Commune with Nature spell, but only as a ritual.

features.name: Totemic Attunement
features.description: You gain a magical benefit based on a totem animal of your choice.
